intro: Vochysia javitensis, commonly known as the golden spondias, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, orange-colored fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
